seo.title: 7‑Day Amalfi Coast Itinerary (without a car)
seo.description: One week across the coast with realistic pacing and transport tips.

intro: Seven days without a car lets you balance classic sights with slower village time—use ferries for comfort and buses for value.

sections.title: Days 1–2 — settle in Positano
body: Arrive via Naples or Salerno, explore Spiaggia Grande and Fornillo, and adjust to the stairs with short walks to viewpoints.
Book a shared boat or cooking class for the second evening to anchor the week with a standout experience.

sections.title: Day 3 — Capri loop
body: Catch the 08:30 ferry to Capri, focus on Anacapri in the morning, and return before sunset to avoid last-boat scrambles.
Keep a bus ticket stash ready in case ferries halt; Sorrento back-up routes take around 90 minutes door to door.

sections.title: Days 4–5 — Amalfi & Ravello + hiking
body: Spend day 4 between Amalfi town and Ravello’s gardens, staying late if a concert tempts you.
Dedicate day 5 to the Path of the Gods or Montepertuso trail; start early, carry 1.5 L (51 oz) of water, and ride the bus back.

sections.title: Days 6–7 — culture & buffer
body: Take a morning train to Pompeii or Salerno for museums, then return for a relaxed final evening in Positano.
Keep the last day as a buffer for weather or pure leisure—repeat a favourite beach or wander artisan shops.

tips: Laundry mid-week keeps bags light; use self-service machines near Chiesa Nuova.
Track ferry updates on operator Instagram accounts during windy spells.

faqs.q: Should I stay in more than one town?
a: Base in Positano for fewer repacks. Add a night in Naples or Salerno only if you have very early trains or flights.

faqs.q: Do I need to pre-book everything?
a: Reserve ferries, boat tours, and headline restaurants. Leave hikes, beach days, and local buses flexible so you can adapt to weather.
